courses.title: Introduction to Computational Science and Engineering
courses.description: This course will introduce students to major research areas in computational science and engineering.

courses.title: Computational Problem Solving for Scientists and Engineers
courses.description: Computing principles, computer architecture, algorithms and data structure; software development, parallelism. No credit for graduate students or undergraduates in Computer Science or Computational Media.

courses.title: Computing for Data Analysis: Methods and Tools
courses.description: Computational techniques needed for data analysis; programming, accessing databases, multidimensional arrays, basic numerical computing, and visualization; hands-on applications and case studies. Credit is will not be awarded for both CSE 6040 and CX 4240.

courses.title: Computational Science and Engineering Algorithms
courses.description: This course will introduce students to designing high-performance and scalable algorithms for computational science and engineering applications. The course focuses on algorithms design, complexity analysis, experimentation, and optimization, for important science and engineering applications.

courses.title: Massive Graph Analysis
courses.description: Algorithms and data structures for massive graphs; programming, parallelism; principles, challenges, opportunities in graph analysis; hands-on application, case studies.

courses.title: High Performance Computing
courses.description: This course will introduce students to the design, analysis, and implementation of high performance computational science and engineering applications.

courses.title: Multicore Computing: Concurrency and Parallelism on the Desktop
courses.description: This course will introduce students to the design and analysis of real-world algorithms on multicore computers.

courses.title: High Performance Parallel Computing: Tools and Applications
courses.description: Introduction to MIMD parallel computation, using textbook excerpts, resesarch papers, and projects on multiple parallel machines. Emphasizes practical issues in high-performance computing.

courses.title: Parallel and Distributed Simulation
courses.description: Algorithms and techniques used in parallel/distributed discrete event simulation systems. Synchronization algorithms, data distribution, applications to high performance analytic simulations and distributed virtual environments.

courses.title: Web Search and Text Mining
courses.description: Basic and advanced methods for Web information retrieval and text mining: indexing and crawling, IR models, link and click data, social search, text classification and clustering.

courses.title: Pattern Matching Algorithms
courses.description: Foundations and algorithms underlying the development and application of tools for the efficient searching, matching and discovery of discrete.

courses.title: Data and Visual Analytics
courses.description: The course introduces students to analysis and visualization of complex high dimensional data.  Both theory and applications will be covered including several practical case studies.

courses.title: Advanced Topics in Machine Learning
courses.description: Advanced machine learning topics including graphical models, kernel methods, boosting, bagging, semi-supervised and active learning, and tensor approach to data analysis.

courses.title: Big Data Analytics for Healthcare
courses.description: Big data systems, scalable machine learning algorithms, health analytic applications, electronic health records.

courses.title: Algorithms for Bioinformatics and Computational Biology
courses.description: Foundations and algorithms underlying the development and application of tools for the efficient management and processing of biomolecular data.

courses.title: Numerical Linear Algebra
courses.description: Introduction to numerical solutions of the classical problems of linear algebra including linear systems, least squares, singular value decomposition, and eigen value problems. Crosslisted with MATH 6643.

courses.title: Iterative Methods for Systems of Equations
courses.description: Iterative methods for linear and nonlinear systems of equations including Jacobi, G-S, SOR, CG, multigrid, Newton, quasi-Newton, updating, and gradient based methods. Crosslisted with MATH 6644.

courses.title: Numerical Methods in Computational Science and Engineering I
courses.description: Introduction to numerical algorithms widely used in computational science and engineering. Numerical linear algebra, linear programming, and applications. Crosslisted with MATH 6710.

courses.title: Numerical Methods in Computational Science and Engineering II
courses.description: Efficient numerical techniques for solving partial differential equations and large-scale systems of equations arising from discretization of partial differential equations or variational problems in applications in science and engineering. Crosslisted with MATH 6711.

courses.title: Modeling and Simulation: Foundations and Implementation
courses.description: Foundations and algorithms concerning the development of conceptual models for systems, and their realization in the form of computer software; discrete and continuous models. Crosslisted with ECE 6730.

courses.title: Computational Data Analysis: Learning, Mining, and Computation
courses.description: Theoretical/computational foundations of analyzing large/complex modern datasets, including the fundamental concepts of machine learning and data mining needed for both resesarch and practice. Crosslisted with ISYE 6740. Credit not awarded for both CSE 6740 and CS 4641/7641/ISYE 6740.

courses.title: Modeling, Simulation and Military Gaming
courses.description: Focuses on the creation and use of modeling and simulation tools to analyze and train students regarding strategic events in international relations. Crosslisted with INTA 6742.

courses.title: Applied Analytics Practicum
courses.description: Practical analytics project experience applying ideas from the classroom to a significant project of interest to a business, government agency, or other organization.

courses.title: Mathematical Foundations of Machine Learning
courses.description: Provides the mathematical background for two of the pillars of modern data science: linear algebra and applied probability.

courses.title: Probabilistic Graphical Models in Machine Learning
courses.description: The course provides an introduction to theory and practice of graphical models in machine learning. It covers three main aspects; representation, probabilistic inference, and learning.

courses.title: Machine learning in computational biology
courses.description: Introduction to modern machine learning techniques in computational biology.

courses.title: Computational Science and Engineering Seminar
courses.description: Group discussion concerning advanced topics in Computational Science and Engineering.

courses.title: Computational Science and Engineering Seminar
